info: 呑む is often used metaphorically; 服む is often used for medicine

english_definitions: to hold back from saying something
to hold one's breath (in fear, anxiety, etc.)
to have one's breath taken away
mythical Japanese oni (demon) who lived on Mt. Ōe

links.text: Read “酒呑童子” on Japanese Wikipedia

english_definitions: drinking at home (as opposed to going out)
being so broad-minded as to accept all sorts of things, both good and evil
being broad-minded enough to be tolerant of people of all shades
taking something in without fully understanding it
drinking at home (as opposed to going out)
taste (of a liquid, esp. alcoholic beverages)
place one's lips touch on the rim of a cup
shape of one's mouth when drinking

see_also: ノミ行為 ノミこうい

english_definitions: drinking establishment where one drinks while standing
to go on a pub crawl
to be broad-minded enough to associate with various types of people

data.slug: 指切拳万、嘘ついたら針千本呑ます

japanese.word: 指切拳万、嘘ついたら針千本呑ます
japanese.reading: ゆびきりげんまんうそついたらはりせんぼんのます

english_definitions: Finger cut-off, ten thousand fist-punches, whoever lies has to swallow a thousand needles
words said when making a pinky swear

japanese.reading: あみどんしゅうのうおをもらす
あみどんしゅうのうおをもらす

english_definitions: the law has holes large enough for the most wicked men to slip through
the long arm of the law doesn't reach everywhere
fishes big enough to eat boats aren't caught by the net
